examples: But for Buck, this was getting dangerously close to the bone.
By the mid 1960s, peregrines were dangerously close to extinction.
This comes dangerously close to online gambling.
Dangerously clogged blood vessels can be widened by a procedure called an angioplasty.
But it is dangerously close to looking sharp, that text.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is capable of harming or injuring a person or destroying or damaging a thing
words.defineVi: theo cách có khả năng làm hại hoặc làm bị thương một người hoặc phá hủy hoặc làm hỏng một thứ

examples: Although she didn't speak the language fluently, she was able to get by with basic phrases and gestures.
He wants to become bilingual and speak multiple languages fluently.
Of course, not all deaf people can read English fluently.
It merges fluently with outer space, where there's no atmosphere at all.
People's opinions sway one way and ignore people who aren’t signing fluently.
words.defineEn: in an easy, effortless, and correct manner
words.defineVi: một cách dễ dàng, dễ dàng và chính xác

examples: The horse took the first fence well.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
The glue is taking well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
words.defineEn: in a way that is right, good, or satisfactory
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là đúng, tốt, hoặc thỏa đáng

examples: Guy sneezed loudly.
We cheer loudly for our favorite soccer team during the match.
We cheer loudly for our school's volleyball team during their matches.
To laugh loudly/aloud/heartily.
Startled by the sudden noise, the baby began to cry loudly.
words.defineEn: producing a sound or noise with high volume
words.defineVi: tạo ra âm thanh hoặc tiếng ồn với âm lượng lớn

examples: This disaster comes hard on the heels of last week’s train crash.
The kids always work hard at school.
For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.
Life on the road can be very hard.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: needing a lot of skill or effort to do
words.defineVi: cần rất nhiều kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để làm

examples: No one took me seriously because of my lack of experience and seniority.
Wait, he seriously thinks the most popular girl in school would go out with him?
f you keep crying wolf, people won't take you seriously when you really need them.
I wish you'd take me seriously.
Don't take them seriously, the wine has gone to their heads.
words.defineEn: in a way that is serious

examples: Cutting him some slack won't make him behave more politely next time you know.
offered St John politely.
A sign outside the drive-in movie theater politely asks patrons not to bring in any dynamite.
I turned politely to the young man.
the cashier asked politely as she took the woman's money.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is respectful and understanding of the needs and feelings of others
words.defineVi: theo cách tôn trọng và hiểu biết về nhu cầu và cảm xúc của người khác

examples: Samantha played it cool during the storm, calmly directing people to safety and finding extra food and water for everyone.
A mother calmly reassures her terrified child that the robots are not looking for her.
"Speak slowly, calmly and clearly."
She went on sewing calmly.
Calmly, might I add.
words.defineVi: không căng thẳng hoặc cảm xúc mạnh mẽ

examples: Troops drove out the demonstrators.
Hunger drives the wolf out of the wood.
A stream of black cars drove by.
A stream of black cars drove by.
The waves drove against the shore.
words.defineEn: to control the movement and the speed of a car, bus, truck, etc. when it is moving
words.defineVi: để kiểm soát chuyển động và tốc độ của ô tô, xe buýt, xe tải, v.v. khi nó đang di chuyển

examples: His frame spoke tiredness.
He spoke the final words of the play.
The brochure speaks of beautiful secluded grounds.
My mother spoke Russian.
Please speak more slowly.
words.defineEn: to use one's voice to express a particular feeling or to communicate information
words.defineVi: sử dụng giọng nói của một người để thể hiện một cảm giác cụ thể hoặc để truyền đạt thông tin

examples: Treat yourselves to a good meal.
They treated him like a dog.
The creamy sapodilla milkshake was a refreshing treat on a hot summer day.
A juicy pear is a refreshing treat on a hot summer day.
The loganberry pie at the local bakery is a delicious summer treat.
words.defineEn: to deal with or behave toward someone or something in a particular way
words.defineVi: để đối phó với hoặc cư xử đối với một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó trong một cách cụ thể

examples: My wife talked sense into me.
Your friend really talks a blue streak!
The two men talked.
A true leader walks the talk.
He talked a blue streak all through breakfast.
words.defineEn: to tell someone about the information, feelings, or ideas that we have
words.defineVi: để nói với ai đó về thông tin, cảm xúc hoặc ý tưởng mà chúng tôi có

examples: The students worked their heart and soul on their project.
Not working my foot.
Soymilk works well as a substitute for milk in sauces and creamy pasta dishes.
My dad works forty hours a week.
To work clay.
words.defineEn: to do certain physical or mental activities in order to achieve a result or as a part of our job
words.defineVi: để làm một số hoạt động thể chất hoặc tinh thần để đạt được một kết quả hoặc là một phần của công việc của chúng tôi

examples: Take your pick.
His new world record will take some beating.
His apology took the edge off her anger.
Things like this take time.
The river took a meandering bend through the picturesque valley.
words.defineEn: to reach for something and hold it
words.defineVi: để đạt được cho một cái gì đó và giữ nó

examples: My grandmother made a dress for me.
The bride's wedding dress is white.
She bought an expensive dress for a special occasion.
Where did you buy that dress?
This dress makes me look fat.
Your car is waiting, sir.
C'm on the crowd is waiting.
We waited there for the better part of an hour.
What are you waiting for?
Leeds United had waited for success for eighteen years.
words.defineEn: to not leave until a person or thing is ready or present or something happens
words.defineVi: để không rời đi cho đến khi một người hoặc điều đã sẵn sàng hoặc hiện tại hoặc một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: I shouldn't have behaved like that.
The teacher's stern grimace warned the students to behave.
Cutting him some slack won't make him behave more politely next time you know.
The sudden fame has turned her head, making her behave arrogantly and disregard others' opinions.
Sally's usually very well behaved, so I gave her a pass on this one.
words.defineEn: to act in a particular way
words.defineVi: hành động theo một cách cụ thể

examples: He polished his leather shoes to make them look shiny.
All it needs is a lick of polish and it’ll look like new.
My father cleaned and polished the wooden furniture to keep it looking nice.
Growing up as the son of a Polish immigrant, I was raised by a man who often seemed more Catholic than the Pope himself.
He made a fuss of his new car, spending hours meticulously cleaning and polishing every inch of it.
words.defineEn: to rub the surface of something, mostly by using a brush or a piece of cloth, to make it bright, smooth, and shiny
words.defineVi: để chà bề mặt của một cái gì đó, chủ yếu bằng cách sử dụng một bàn chải hoặc một mảnh vải, để làm cho nó sáng, mịn và sáng bóng
